review_blob: Aroma is lacking typical IPA hops forward has a rotten peach instead and a slight burn of alcohol on the nose hairs Apperance: a light red/orange color Taste: not enough of the flavor of the hops in this I get the bitter on the tongue but nothing in the taste and the end is almost metallic I hate that Palate: drinkable on the throat no overpowering bubbles but it leaves a coating on my tongue and teeth again I dont like that overall I would not recommend this beer to an IPA drinker, possibly to a light ale newbie

Aroma: Strong hops at first, sweet grassy barnyard follows towards the end I start to smell a hint of sweaty sock. Appearance: clear effervesent amber color. Taste: perfectly bitter and does not have the overly sweet taste I feared from the aroma Palate: smooth in the mouth and velvet on the throat a bit carbonated but the bitterness I like makes up for it Finish: Overall this is a nice IPA it didnt change my world but its refreshing
